. The BA model is generated by using a linear preferential attachment algorithm that produces scale-free networks with a power-law degree distribution p( k) ∝ k − α with α = 3. The WS model has a Dirac degree distribution centered at K (all nodes have the same degree) when the rewiring probability tends to 0. If the rewiring probability tends to 1, the degree distribution is Poisson. For intermediate values, the shape of the degree distribution has a pronounced peak at k = K and decays exponentially for large | k − K|. A WS network is characterized by a relatively homogeneous structure, as all nodes have more or less the same degree, and by a high degree of local clustering as opposed to ER and BA networks. The networks were simulated using the igraph package in R [ 27].
